Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Mummy breast cover
Description: Trapezoid-shaped mummy breast cover. From top to bottom: a wesekh-collar with two falcon heads (with nothing between them, it appears). A kneeling goddess (Nut), coiffed with a solar disc, with out-stretched wings and possibly holding two Maat feathers in her hands. The four mummiform sons of Horus, in pairs, flanking the sides of the door on which the goddess is kneeling. On the left, Hepi and Qebehsenuf (facing right), on the right Duamutef and Amset (facing left).
